November 20th, 1951
Mr. Jim Miles
Executive Director
NAEB Tape Network
119 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Jims
I was delighted to see your letter of November 14th,
as well as the NAEB Policy letter #5*
Before going any further, let me congratulate you on
the latter. It is a swell Idea, and I hope that the circulation is
expanded*
Insofar as your November 14th epistle is concerned, I
hope I have never given you the idea that neither you nor Frank should
not spend Thanksgiving with your families . I merely feel rather
strongly that it will take more than 24 or 56 hours with Hull, and
with Griffith’s oM gal to absorb the results of years of operation
by the old guy©
One of our great difficulties at all times is the
necessity of rushing through a meeting because of lack of time.
Mcybe you and Frank are able to absorb at a faster rate than the
rest of us poor mortals. However, both of you are sufficiently
eware of the importance of learning everything possible about the
financial set-up, the membership situation, etc. I rely entirely
on your own judgment*
The December 4th meeting in Washington, in connection
with the unveiling of the monitoring studies, has been tentatively
cancelled. Basically, this is due to lack of funds.
' I would love to be able to come to the School Broadcast
Conference, but I fear there is neither time nor money available. The
school situation is an extremely important one for NAEB. The problem
of providing Network service to school stations must be tackled without
delay» A glance at our membership list will show the tremendous
proportion of school operations as compared with colleges and universities.
Unless we can provide school stations with the service they desire, I
do not see how we are going to be able to c<£" Wet any Network service fee®
I have been receiving letters from all over the country concerning this
lack of emphasis on our part. ’Whether we like it or not, this is a number
one problem, vtiich must be solved, and which I look to you and Alvin Gaines
Jim Macandrew, et al, to get solved.
(more)
